Description: Ostracon, section (joins with 1923,0327.137.b) of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a red-brown slip and remains of the beginnings of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a draft or copy of an epitaph.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.77)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (372009) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/372009)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 61 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
